abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Reform Support Grant
            Project is designed to help implement the Government's
            economic reform program during 2006, and Burundi's
            Interim Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (I-PRSP) by
            supporting key policy measures aimed at a) improving public
            expenditure management and their impact on the poor; and, b)
            accelerating growth. In particular, the operation is
            expected to translate into improved services for the poor
            and greater well being of the population, and, increased
            income-generating activities - employment opportunities
            through private sector development and State disengagement -
            as well as increased producer income, through coffee, tea
            and cotton sector reforms. Notwithstanding, several risks
            could influence the expected project outcomes, namely,
            instability and disruption of the peace process, external
            factors, policy reversals and/or slippages in key reforms,
            weak capacity, fiduciary risks, and, shortfall in donor support.
